summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Log for August 10-11, 2019, documenting the shift activities and the critical incident where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital. It details staff shortages, inmate counts, and the medical emergency response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 (also listed as #76310-054) who was found unresponsive in his cell (Special Housing Unit, cell Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019. CPR was performed, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital.

persons.name: Lt. Anderson
persons.context: Mentioned as being relieved of duty at approximately 5:30 AM on August 10, 2019, by the incoming Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant.

persons.name: Bright
persons.context: Inmate #76309-054 listed as being on Suicide Watch with an inmate companion in the initial summary section.

persons.name: Gentile
persons.context: Inmate #71230-054 listed on Suicide Watch/Psychological Observation with an inmate companion across multiple log entries.

persons.name: Ramos
persons.context: Inmate #85428-054 (also listed as 485428-054) listed as pending bed space in SHU and later on Psychological Observation with an inmate companion.

persons.name: Felix
persons.context: Inmate #85775-054 listed on Psychological Observation and later transferred to Special Housing on Psych Observation on the evening of August 10.

persons.name: Williams
persons.context: Inmate #78640-054 listed on Psychological Observation/Suicide Watch and later transferred to Special Housing on Psych Observation on the evening of August 10.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate #86824-054 listed as being in a Dry Cell under staff watch in R&D and later transferred to Special Housing (dry cell) on August 9.

persons.name: Mutimura
persons.context: Inmate #76329-054 mentioned in the Day Watch log for August 9, 2019, with a count adjustment of +1.

persons.name: Carreon-Macias
persons.context: Inmate #10285B-19B mentioned in the Day Watch log for August 9, 2019, with a count adjustment of -1 due to a bail bond.

connections.description: Lt. Anderson was the Operations Lieutenant on duty prior to the shift change just before Epstein was found unresponsive.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit. CPR was initiated, 911 was called at 6:35 AM, EMS arrived at 6:43 AM, and Epstein was transported to a local hospital via ambulance at 7:10 AM with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Staff Shortages Reported
events.description: The Morning Watch and Evening Watch shifts reported correctional assignments (Sanitation and 10 South #2) were vacated due to a shortage of staff.

events.title: Inmate Transfers and Release
events.description: During the Day Watch on August 9, inmate Mutimura was added to the count, inmate Fernandez was transferred to special housing (dry cell), and inmate Carreon-Macias was released on a bail bond.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed, EMS was called, and Epstein was transported to a local hospital via ambulance at 7:10 AM with CPR still ongoing.
The report notes staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments on both the Morning and Evening Watch shifts.
The Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative, and the public address system was malfunctioning, preventing PREA announcements.
The log provides a detailed minute-by-minute account of the institution's activities, counts, and the medical emergency response.
